page.description: Define the next field in a table.
page.syntax: V Field_Add(C Fieldname,C Fieldtype[,N Field_Width[,N Field_Decimal[,C flags]]]])

argument.name: Fieldname
argument.description: The name of the field to create.

argument.name: Fieldtype
argument.description: The field types, the single character codes used to represent them, and the valid parameters associated with them are:

item.name: Numeric "N"
item.description: Fieldname, Field Type, Width , Decimal Width

argument.name: Field_Width
argument.description: Optional. The number of characters to allocate to the field.

argument.name: Field_Decimal
argument.description: Optional. The number of character positions after the decimal point.

page.discussion: The TABLE.FIELD_ADD() method is used between the TABLE.CREATE_BEGIN() and TABLE.CREATE_END() methods to define the fields that form a table structure. The first field of the table is always defined with TABLE.CREATE_BEGIN(), subsequent fields are defined with TABLE.FIELD_ADD(). A field definition consists of at least two parameters, the Field_Name and Field_Type, and can contain up two optional parameters, Width and Decimal_Width. Field_Type is a single-character code representing one of the field types. The chosen field type determines how the optional parameters are used. If the field type is Character, an additional Width parameter is supplied, and if the field type is Numeric, the additional Width and optional Decimal_Width parameters are specified. Date, Memo, Rich text memo, Bitmap, OLE, and Logical fields are always defined with two parameters because the field widths for these field types are set automatically.

section.title: Example
section.example: table.create_begin("firstname","c",30) table.field_add("lastname","c",30) table.field_add("price","n",5,2) table.field_add("quantity","n",2) table.field_add("birthday","d") 'The create_end method creates the table and assign an object pointer to the table tbl = table.create_end("sample.dbf")
